content: I would like to know who is the designated openbsd target maintainer (which is mandatory per Target Tier Policy)
all targets are Tier 3. I did x86_64, i686 and sparc64 initial port (and maintain them on openbsd side)
a powerpc target was added, but without any contact with openbsd developers (and I am unsure it is functional: no libc support until very recently, and invalid char signess in std)
I would be fine to participate to maintainership of all openbsd targets

Likely no one, since most of those targets predate the policy's acceptance - if you want to list yourself, filing PRs which pretend that the target didn't exist before (i.e. listing out the requirements for tier 3 from scratch) is likely the way to go.

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/tree/master/src/doc/rustc/src/platform-support is the directory with currently listed maintainers.

It is "acceptable" for tier 3 targets to be nonfunctional, though we obviously appreciate help in making them be less. They are expected to be in a liminal state, where they might theoretically build with... maybe various degrees of hacking.

openbsd targets are tier 3 mostly because of crosscompilation requirement: LLVM doesn't build of out-of-box for targeting OpenBSD. all targets I am maintaining built natively and are effectively used to build programs and libraries on OpenBSD (like firefox, librsvg, py-cryptography, ...)
